_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan-Executive Summary

Facility: Trotter Fertilizer
City: Hazard, Ne.
Contact: Dean Wood
Phone:308-446-2545

1. Facility Policy.

       The owners,management, and employees fo Trotter Fertilizer are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia. If a accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, Sherman County LEPC, and other authorities, to mitigate any release and minimize the impact to the release to persons and the environment.

2. Facility Information.

        The primary activity at the facility is the storage of fertilizer for sale to farmers. Anhydrous Ammonia is received, stored and distributed for direct application as a nutrient for crop production. The maximum quantity stored would be 373,000 pounds in a storage tank and nurse tanks.        
     

3. Accidental Release Prevention Program.

          The facility is in compliance with the provisions of "Safety Requirements for th Storage and handling of Anhydrous Ammonia K-61.1", published by The American National Standards Institute, In., (ANSI), and the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CRF 1910.111, "Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia". The OSHA standard is referenced in this 
 Registration Form, see Section 8.3 (b).

4. Five Year Accident History.

         There have been no accidental releases on anhydrous ammonia in the last five years that have caused any deaths, injuries or significant property damage at the facility; nor, to our knowledge, has THERE BEEN ANY ACCIDENTAL RELEASES resulting in off-site deaths injuries, evacuation, property damage, or environmental damage.

5.Emergency Response Program.

The Facility has:
     a. A written action plan, in accordance with OSHA standar
